p: Rootking OSCP Certified
Tips & tricks for bloodhound
sharphound.ps1
sharphound.exe

Right click on node allow you to get information about the node and also how to compromise the user / machine. Always tag owned node, this can be useful during an internal pentest to note where you are. It's then possible to ask the shortest path to a node from the owned ones.
A powerful post-exploitation tool used for auditing and assessing large Active Directory networks.

Without Kerberos preauthentication in place, an attacker could send an AS-REQ to the domain controller on behalf of any AD user. After obtaining the AS-REP from the domain controller, the attacker could perform an offline password attack against the encrypted part of the response.
Our Kali machine is not joined to the domain, we also have to provide domain user credentials to obtain the TGS-REP hash.
You must be in the Domain
Rubeus

To perform a dcsync attacks user needs to have the Replicating Directory Changes, Replicating Directory Changes All, and Replicating Directory Changes in Filtered Set rights. By default, members of the Domain Admins, Enterprise Admins, and Administrators groups have these rights assigned.
Allows execution of any shell command as long as the authenticated user is authorized.
A powerful post-exploitation tool used for auditing and assessing large Active Directory networks.
Inspect client foothold in order to perform Client side attacks
Once we got some file to inspect, we can use exiftool to display metadata of any files.
http://canarytokens.com to confirm that victim use specific OS to perform our attack.
